channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Horrendous Mess, 23rd October
item.description:
Multiple times I’ve posted about this problem and the Council is doing nothing about it. What is going on? What would happen if everyone in the area stopped paying their Council Tax over the issue? It’s getting that bad. We are looking at 6 - 8 weeks this gas been going on.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Our Mew is finally been cleaned by one of your cleaning van but only the entrance of the Mew is cleaned. The van needs to clean all the way in the Mew., 23rd October
item.description:
Please clean all the Mew with the cleaning van not just the entrance. We have lots of rubbish that’s never cleaned

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Bridford Mews, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster

item.title: Tree fallen blockjng psyh to train station, 23rd October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Lower Station Road, Crayford, London

item.title: You need to repair the roundabout, 23rd October
item.description:
I can see that this was already raised in January 2024 and nothing seems to have been done. The round about in the longmoore gardens play area is broken. That is super important for children with and without special needs as it supports inclusion. Please do not wait any further and fix it or replace it with one that is upper level and easy to maintain. Thanks you very much in advance!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169A, Vauxhall Bridge Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti has begun multiplying in this area again, 23rd October
item.description:
It is turning the area into a ghetto and devaluing the properties in the area. I believe more permanent measures need to be taken to prevent this, e.g. CCTV to catch the thugs who are defacing the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Vale, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The black council litter bin has disappeared from Chandos Avenue opposite Grangeview Road. Litter has been left scattered on the pavement/road where it was located., 23rd October
item.description:
The litter bin has disappeared and rubbish is being left on the ground-pavement and kerb. There is a need for this bin as there are take away restaurants nearby and food packaging and bottles are thrown on the ground

item.title: Lights on railway bridge not working, 23rd October
item.description:
There are 5 lights inoperative on the railway bridge at the end of Aylesbury Road. One light on the Aylesbury Road side, two across the top, and 2 on the other side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aylesbury Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous trees overhanging our property, 23rd October
item.description:
There are two dangerously listing trees overhanging my property.Bromley Council worked on two trees in this area over the summer but these trees were untouched. Limbs have fallen in the recent strong winds and I am concerned the whole trees may come down as both are listing badly. If this was to happen they would hit my property and cause serious damage and possible injury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highgrove Close, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pool of dirty smelly water across road and footpath nxt lamppost, 23rd October
item.description:
Enormous pool of dirty smelling water full of organic matter, not draining, now eroding footpath, being sprayed over pedestrians by every vehicle that drives through it. This needs to be drained and surface water managed in someway so that it does not put Road users at risk, especially pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downs Bridge Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to property due to lack of drainage, 23rd October
item.description:
Due to lack of road drainage for approx 200m on Logs Hill in heavy rain it becomes a virtual river with nowhere for the rainwater to go. This has caused damage to our driveway as sometimes the water comes up to 1m into our driveway. The rainwater has taken way our driveway material numerous times so now it is pointless us in replacing. The flow has been so bad it has created several holes in the driveway that are increasing with every heavy rainfall.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Logs Hill, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
